Recipe.title: Dutch Oven BBQ Spare Ribs
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of Bobbi Beagley
Recipe.Description: When Jennie was growing up, her mom used to make a wonderful BBQ Spare Ribs recipe. After we were married, she shared the recipe with us, but when we made it, it turned out totally different. It turns out that instead of using Tomato Paste, like the recipe calls for, she always used Tomato Sauce, so it was runny and didn't taste as good.

section.instruction: Heat Dutch Oven with high heat from the bottom, then add the Spare Ribs and stir them occasionally.
Meanwhile, in a seaparate container, mix all the Sauce Ingredients.
When the Spare Ribs are brown, move the Dutch Oven to medium low heat, pour Sauce over the Spare Ribs, and gently stir until Spare Ribs are all coated in sauce.
Put the lid on the Dutch Oven and simmer, stirring occationally.
Simmer until the Spare Ribs are cooked. (ToDo: Need to verify this takes about 1 hour.)

Notes.note: CAUTION: If you over-cook the ribs they will begin to fall apart, and you end up with shredded BBQ pork or beef.
When serving the ribs, the extra sauce tastes wonderful over baked potatoes, with a dollop of sour cream.
